Okay thanks, I'm wondering if:
mlpack/CMakeLists.txt
Line 76 in 46a14f3
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -Wall -Wextra -ftemplate-depth=1000")
is set. Can you post the contents of CMakeCache.txt (in the build folder) as well? And what version of mlpack are you building?

I added the line
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -Wall -Wextra -ftemplate-depth=1000") to the file CMakeLists.txt and the cmake stage succeeded with Python bindings off However, make failed, still complaining about the template depth issue
/opt/local/include/boost/mpl/if.hpp:70:22: note: use -ftemplate-depth=N to increase recursive template instantiation depth I'm not sure where this flag belongs. -Marcus <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
